prompt.p: A 65-year-old man has severe bone pain, particularly in the pelvis and lower spine. An X-ray shows multiple lytic lesions. In addition, his creatinine levels have been increasing over the last few months.
Upon serum electrophoresis, a monoclonal band is seen.
Which condition is this man likely to have?

modalFeedback.p:
Option D (Multiple myeloma) is Correct. He is most likely to have multiple myeloma. He displays the classical signs of this.
Option A (Metastatic breast cancer) is Incorrect. This would not result in a monoclonal band or renal failure.
Option B (Monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance (MGUS)) is Incorrect. This would not result in renal failure or lytic lesions; only a monoclonal band.
Option C (Metastatic lung cancer) is Incorrect. This would not result in a monoclonal band or renal failure.
Option E (Osteoporosis) is Incorrect. This would not result in a monoclonal band or renal failure.
